questions.question: Which sentence is in the present tense?

choices.answer: The man in the yellow hat is smart.
The man in the yellow hat is sleeping on the bed.
The man in the yellow hat fell down the stairs.
Did you know the man in the yellow hat?

questions.question: Which sentence is in the future tense?

choices.answer: Will, a very smart boys, will leave for college in the fall.
Do you know Will?
My brother's name is Will.
Will, a very smart boy, wants to go to college in the fall.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the past tense?

choices.answer: After the party, they found another the party.
After the party, they will go eat pizza.
After the party, he was going to go to Tom's house.
After the party, come right home.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the present tense?

choices.answer: Do you know the way to San Jose?
Did you go to the University in San Jose?
I went to the University of California at San Jose.
San Jose was a city in California.

questions.question: What tense is this sentence:   Free images were available on the internet.

choices.answer: past
past continuous
future
present

questions.question: What tense is this sentence:   Did everyone know what to do?

choices.answer: past
past continuous
present
present continuous

questions.question: What tense is this sentence:   Will you ever understand the truth?

choices.answer: future
past
present
present continuous

questions.question: Subject:  the men        Verb:  go       Tense:  past

choices.answer: Last year the men went to Chicago.
Last year the men were living in Chicago.
Last year the men felt happy.
Last year the men played golf.

questions.question: Subject:  the bird       Verb:  fly       Tense:  past continuous

choices.answer: The bird is flying in the sky.
The bird was flying in the sky.
The bird flew in the sky.
The bird were flying in the sky.
Does the boy play basketball?
Do the boy play basketball?
Did the boy play basketball?
Is the boy playing basketball?

questions.question: Subject:  the ice cream       Verb:  melt       Tense:  present continuous

choices.answer: Is the ice cream melting on the counter?
The ice cream was melting on the counter.
The ice cream melted on the counter.
The ice cream are melting on the counter.
The party lasted for hours.
The party will last for hours.
The party was lasting for hours.
The party were lasting for hours.
The woman wins all of the elections.
The woman win all of the elections.
Do the woman win all of the elections?
The woman is winning all of the elections.
The campfire is burning in the fire ring.
The campfire are burning in the fire ring.
The campfire was burning in the fire ring.
The campfire were burning in the fire ring.

questions.question: How many tenses have we studied?

choices.answer: Five
Six
Four
Seven
